meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I shook the tree to get the apples.
meanings.sent2: She shook the rug to remove the dust.
meanings.sent3: The earthquake shook the ground so hard, even the birds were surprised.
meanings.sent4: His words shook her to the core, making her rethink everything.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm shook the windows, making the whole house tremble.

meanings.definition: to cause to tremble or vibrate
meanings.sent1: The loud music shook the walls of the room.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake shook the entire city, causing panic.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news shook him, making him drop his coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter shook the room, spreading joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The train passing by shook the ground beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: a simple past tense and past participle of shake
meanings.sent1: She shook the bottle before opening it.
meanings.sent2: He shook his head in disbelief.
meanings.sent3: The dog shook off the water after swimming in the lake.
meanings.sent4: The dancer shook her hips to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent5: The wind shook the leaves off the trees in the autumn breeze.

meanings.sent1: The sad movie shook her, bringing tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news shook the entire family.
meanings.sent3: His joke shook her with laughter, brightening her day.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt apology shook him, making him forgive instantly.
meanings.sent5: The touching story shook the audience, leaving them in awe.
